## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r import, message=FALSE}
df <- read_csv("../data/birdstrikes_clean.csv")
df['one'] = 1
head(df)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
p <- ggplot(data = df %>% group_by(year, airport) %>% summarize(count = n()), aes(x = factor(year), y = airport)) +
  geom_tile(aes(fill = count)) +
  scale_fill_continuous(type = "viridis")# +
  
p
```
```{r}
ggplotly(p) %>% config(modeBarButtonsToRemove = c("zoom2d", "zoomIn2d", "zoomOut2d", "pan2d",
                                                 "select2d", "lasso2d", "toggleSpikelines", "hoverCompareCartesian"),
                      displaylogo = FALSE)

```

```{r}
dmg_unique <- unique(df$damage_level)
make_heatmap_plot( years = c(1990,2002), dmg_lvl = dmg_unique, y_var = state){
  dmg_vect <- vector()
  for(i in dmg_lvl){
    dmg_vect <- c(dmg_vect, i) 
  }
  
  if(length(dmg_vect) != 0 ){
    w_df <- df %>% filter(damage_level %in% dmg_vect) %>% filter(year >= years[1] & year <= years[2]) %>% group_by(year, y_var) %>% summarize(count = n())
    
    h_plot <- ggplot(data = w_df, aes(x = year, y = y_var)) +
      geom_tile(aes(fill = count)) +
      scale_fill_continuous(type = "viridis")
    
    ggplotly(h_plot) %>% config(modeBarButtonsToRemove = c("zoom2d", "zoomIn2d", "zoomOut2d", "pan2d",
                                                 "select2d", "lasso2d", "toggleSpikelines", "hoverCompareCartesian"),
                                displaylogo = FALSE)
    }
  
}
```
